events.name: Front End TL;DR June 2015
events.description: ReferralCandy is where we'll meet up. Come see what their front end engineering team is doing, and spend an evening learning the latest front end technology. Address: Block 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #06-26, Singapore 139951 FEDS is about hands-on, collaborative learning. Join the session if you'd like to learn new front end technology. Schedule: Every third Monday of the month. Different venue each time. 7:00pm — Arrival, registration, seating 7:10pm — Intro talk 7:30pm — Teams work on mini challenges 8:30pm — Presentations, awards 9:00pm — The end. More info: http://feds.strikingly.com/ PS: Bring a laptop and show up a bit earlier to get set up on the wifi.

events.name: Papers We Love SG #010
events.description: Paper #1 - The Derivative of a Regular Type is its Type of One-Hole Contexts : Érdi Gergő - http://strictlypositive.org/diff.pdf Paper #2 - A Protocol for Packet Network Intercommunication: Sayanee Basu - http://www.cs.princeton.edu/courses/archive/fall06/cos561/papers/cerf74.pdf ------------------- What was the last paper within the realm of computing/technology you read and loved? What did it inspire you to build or tinker with? Come share the ideas in an awesome academic/research paper with fellow engineers, programmers, and paper-readers. Lead a session and show off code that you wrote that implements these ideas or just give us the lowdown about the paper (because of HARD MATH!). Otherwise, just come, listen, and discuss. ----------------- Original Meetup : http://www.meetup.com/papers-we-love Papers Repo : https://github.com/papers-we-love/papers-we-love Code of Conduct : https://github.com/papers-we-love/papers-we-love/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md
